entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 13 at 7:42PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Gusty North Winds And Blowing Snow Tonight Through Wednesday... North winds of 15 to 25 mph along with periods of blowing snow will develop along the Norton Sound Coast late tonight and continue into Wednesday. entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THIS MORNING TO MIDNIGHT MDT WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 18 inches, with higher amounts likely in the Tetons and southwest part of Yellowstone National Park. Sustained winds of 20 to 30 mph are expected to gusts to 40 mph at times.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued March 09 at 12:28PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Hydrologic flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...Park County about 12 miles southwest of Cody. The minor flooding caused by an ice jam is impacting areas from the 6Qs road Bridge near StageTrail road, south to just north of the junction of the 6Qs road and Southfork road.
